metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5885 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the (1) vnc_connection_server_message and (2) vnc_color_map_set functions in gtk-vnc before 0.7.0 allow remote servers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involving SetColorMapEntries, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gtk-vnc-2.0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
gvncviewer - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-2.0-0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
libgvnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
python-gtk-vnc - 0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gtk-vnc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-1.3ubuntu2.1').
